Today as my April Fools prank, I created three new newsgroups which
(IMHO) were sorely needed.  Please post to them all profusely when
they are available at your site.

1.  alt.config.control-freaks

This is a group for discussion of why certain individuals wish to
place their own, personal limitations on the alt.* heirarchy.

2.  alt.cabal

This group has been proposed by many people who fall into category (1)
above.  They wanted a moderated group to discuss limiting the alt.*
heirarchy to their own little preferences.  I felt that the best
tactical move in this case was to beat them to the punch by creating
an UN-moderated group. :-) :-)

3.  alt.shut.the.hell.up.geek

This group is dedicated to the immortal Matthew Neill Sharp of
rec.music.industrial.  Or it can be used against group (1) above.



-Howard  "preserving chaos in a systematic fashion" Berkey

>From press@relations.Corp.Sun.COM Thu Apr  1 07:26:41 1993
To: allsun@relations.Corp.Sun.COM
Subject: SUNSTRUCK FLASH: SUNTANK ANNOUNCES SuperSHARK CARRERA CLASSIC

-+This message has been approved for distribution to this alias+-
	

		SUNTANK ANNOUNCES NEW OFFICE WORKSTATIONS

		SuperSHARK CARRERA CLASSIC UNVEILED TODAY

SunTank, a division of SunStruck, Inc., today announced the availability 
of a high performance portable computing system designed for the small 
office environment -- the SuperSHARK Carrera Classic. The new system, based 
on the Convertible Office Submersible Environment (COSE) specification, 
was unveiled this morning in the Mountain View office of company founder, 
Andreas Fish Bechtolshiem.

"This technology is an enhanced version of our SHARKstation product 
line. It shows our total commitment to 32-bite commuting and powerful 
hardware," said Bechtolshiem. "And it's my favorite color, too."

The heart, or rather guts, of the system lie in its 120-Megabuck
SuperSHARK processor chip. Despite being a much smaller version of the 
7-gill processor in the original SHARKstation 1 machine, the new 
SuperSHARK is ferocious enough to destroy its closest competitors in 
seconds.  Today the SuperSHARK was demonstrated performing at an 
astounding 100-tetrabites per second.

The true beauty of the new SuperSHARK system is in its European-engineered 
Carrera packaging. The sleek, aerodynamic chassis is built for high 
maneuverability and has a convenient user interface. "We are delighted that 
the SuperSHARK chip can deliver so much power to our stylish exterior," 
commented Hans EinFranz, project manager for Pisce, the German 
hardbody manufacturer that co-designed the Carrera Classic with 
Bechtolshiem. With a full 200 gallon tank capacity, front and rear 
wheel stabilizers, and roomy plexiglass interior, the SuperSHARK 
Carrera Classic office workstation is truly a user's dream of high 
functionality at a low price. (Suggested retail: $7995, tax, license, 
and dealer-installed Cabriolet top extra. Non-discountable.)

No hardware system is complete without a robust operating 
environment.  The SuperSHARK-powered Carrera system runs Windows ET 
from SunSlosh, a sister company of SunTank. "The WET environment 
puts a whole new motif on transparent, distributed hydrokinetic computing," 
said Ned Zander, president and chief perch at SunSlosh. "Of course, 
no one really knows what that means, but it sounds good. 
Let's just say - the system goes fast, and it's powerful."

At the bottom of the SuperSHARK system is SunLinks, a set of 
ground-level user tools for increased office productivity. The compact 
SunLinks course adds even more stability and entertainment value 
to the Carrera office system.

Initial market reaction for the SuperSHARK and the related technologies 
has been remarkably favorable. "I saw a beta version, and I had to 
have one in my office immediately," commented Lotty Varey, 
Bechtolshiem's neighbor.

SunStruck executive Sturgeon McReely noted, "It's the ultimate 
driving machine. Oh no, that's the other German guys. Anyway, 
it's what I've been trying to develop all along - a computer
that's as easy to use as driving a car."

"This is the pinnacle of the series that I foresaw years ago," 
commented Wilhelm Glad, former user of an on-pond system.

Depending on further market acceptance, the SunTank team may introduce 
an AstroSHARK server version later this summer.

Since so many of you asked, heres some info from the flyer I received
(typography and design by none other than LordNose!)

There is a free event in Golden Gate Park on Sunday, April 18, followed
by a dance Sunday night ($10)... information at the end of this post...


LSD: 50 YEARS AND BEYOND
Friday, April 16, Santa Cruz

MAPS (The Multidisciplinary Association for Psychedelic Studies), Island
Group, and the UC Santa Cruz student group Millbrook West present a
lecture and entertainment event at the UC Santa Cruz Performing Arts
Theatre on the evening of Friday, April 16, the 50th anniversary to the
day of Albert Hofmann's accidental discovery of the psychoactive effects
of LSD.

The focus of the Friday night event will be specifically on LSD and will
combine scientific discussions with personal and artistic expressions.
The event will be a fundraiser for Al Kurland, Richard Yensen, and Donna
Dryer's FDA-approved protocol for the study of LSD in the treatment of
substance abuse; this is the only FDA-approved protocol for the study
of LSD in humans.

Musical entertainment during the breaks and before and after the program
will be provided by Geist.

The theatre will open at 7:00pm for access to vendors and exhibits and
for socializing. The evening's program will begin at 7:30pm and continue,
with one 20-minutre intermission, until 11:15pm. All seats are reserved
and will cost $15 for students, $25 for Island Group or MAPS memebers,
$30 for non-members, and $100 for tickets in the front rows, a buffet
dinner with the presenters prior to the event, and special publications.

Speakers include:
 Robert Anton Wilson, author
 Paul Krassner, editor of The Realist
 Stephen Gaskin, founder of The Farm
 Timothy Leary, psychedelic research pioneer
 Oscar Janiger, Albert Hofmann Foundation, with taped messages from
   Humphrey Osmond and Albert Hofmann
 Lester Grinspoon, Harvard Medical School psychiatrist
 Donna Dryer and Richard Yensen, LSD researchers
 Willis Harmon, president of the Institute for Noetic Sciences
 Ralph Abraham, mathemitician and chaos theorist
 John Robbins, author of Diet for a New America
 Laura Huxley, author of This Timeless Moment
 Claudio Naranjo, author of The Healing Journey
 Matthew Brenner, UCSC Millbrook West
 Bruce Eisner, Island Group
 Rick Doblin, MAPS



PSYCHEDELICS & CANNABIS CONFAB
Saturday, April 17, San Francisco

 From 11:00am - 11:30pm, MAPS, California NORML and CAN (Cannabis Action
Network) will present a series of panel discussions on psyechedelics
and cannabis, with educational displays, photographic and art exhibitions,
a psychedelic art auction, a video room, books, food and vendors at the
First Unitarian Church, 1187 Franklin Street, San Francisco. Musical
entertainment during the breaks and before and after the program will
be provided by Geist.
This event will be a benefit for MAPS and for California NORML to support
medical research with MDMA and marijuana and to reform marijuana laws.
Tickets are $40 for NORML or MAPS members; $45 for non-members. Tickets
are general admission and are good for the entire day's program.

Panels:

 MDMA
 Raves, Harm Reduction, Benefit Enhancement
 Women In Psychedelics
 Marijuana
 Sacred and Healing Plants
 Psychedelics and the Treatment of Substance Abuse
 Psychdeleics and Society
 Drug Policy--Strategies for the Future



PURCHASING TICKETS

Tickets can be purchased by check made payable to MAPS, and sent to
MAPS, c/o NORML, 2215-R Market Street #278, San Francisco, CA 94114.
Credit card purchases can also be made by calling the San Francisco
Cannabis Center and Hemporium at 415/552-7487 and asking to purchase
tickets to either the Santa Cruz or the San Francisco event.
Confirmation of tickets and more detailed information about the
schedules for the various events will be sent to attendees.

Since seats are limited, especially for the Santa Cruz Friday night
event on April 16, purchase your tickets now. Before travelling to
these events without a ticket, call 408/427-1942 for availability.



FUN
Sunday, April 18, San Francisco

FREE EVENT IN GOLDEN GATE PARK
A free outdoor event in Golden Gate Park is being planned for Sunday
afternoon with music and dancing. Terence McKenna will speak at 5:15pm.

MULTI-MEDIA DANCE
 From 8:00pm Sunday, April 18 to sunrise April 19 and beyond, MediaKaos
presents D-Day, a Dionysian celebration in commemoration of the 50th
anniversary of the discovery of LSD-25 by Albert Hofmann, to take place
at 1015 Folsom Avenue, San Francisco. This is a multi-media live music
event featuring Robert Anton WIlson, Rob Breszny (performance artist),
plus sunrise special musical guests. Techno-Industrial dance mix DJ's,
smart drink bars, and more. $10 at the door; for more information call
415/241-1568. 50% of net proceeds will benefit MAPS. MAPS will distribute
harm-reduction information and conduct a survey of the participants.
